content.body: Is there a reason Mozilla's fetch observer API proposal never caught on? Tracking progress within fetch is something that comes up a lot and it seems a nice solution to it. In fact Anne mentioned a very similar idea for this before (not sure if based on that proposal or coincidental)
Luke Warlow: I think it's my idea, but it's been a long time. It mainly needs someone to champion it.
content.formatted_body: Luke Warlow: I think it's my idea, but it's been a long time. It mainly needs someone to champion it.

content.body: TIL, the code is still in Firefox but disabled by default.
baku is extremely quick, sometimes too quick. ðŸ˜…
I don't think it ever dispatches the events in Firefox though (didn't from my test)
What would championing involve? Making a spec PR to fetch that specifies it? Plus maybe a prototype?
Yeah, I think in principle it has implementer support, but it's not a priority for anyone. In that case you can often essentially make it happen by writing the specification and the tests.
